summary.title: Resume
summary.subtitle: A Brief
summary.blurb: Northwestern grad, I’ve worked for agencies, startups and as a freelancer
summary.blurb_tools: Here are some tools I like to use:
summary.more: Check out my full resume for a more detailed list of tools and experience

header.name: Chris Zamierowski
header.blurb: I’m a web developer producing (mostly) front-end solutions that are clean and well-coded. I'm interested in how design and web technologies can be used to enhance user experience. Also, food.

sections.title: Some Things I Use
sections.subtitle: Software, tools, languages, libraries, etc.
sections.description: AngularJS, SASS, Yeoman, Express, Grunt, Jade, Bootstrap, jQuery, Compass, Underscore, Bourbon, Bitters, Neat, gulp, Node.js, Ruby on Rails, Handlebars, HTML5, Karma, Jasmine, PHP, Sublime Text 2, Sketch, PhotoShop, Zeplin, Git (CLI),  Heroku, AWS, GA, Mixpanel, Rollbar, Loggly, npm, Bower, Terminal, Asana, Pivotal Tracker, Balsamiq, pen & paper, Slack

jobs.description: Contract work, worked with team to build single-page online dashboard and on-device webapp for an electronics client.
First hire, responsible for full UI, design and development of web stack of eatmorsel.com.
Built and managed front-end of betterfly.com (acquired 2013), including custom online video chat tool.
Worked together with Design, IA, UX teams to build and deliver sites for clients including Discover Financial Services and E*TRADE.
Provide full design and development of sites for multiple small clients, ranging from portfolio to e-commerce sites.

sections.title: Education
description: Master of Science in Computer Science. Northwestern University, Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science. 2011.
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. Animate Arts (Adjunct Major). Northwestern University, Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science. 2010.

sections.title: Tidbits
description: I sometimes stand while I work
I eat kiwis with the skin on
I appreciate a good oatmeal stout
